title: Games Inbox: What should be the next Zelda remake?
text:
I have to write you to today to tell you how upset I am with Zelda: Link’s Awakening. Upset because I’ve beaten it! What an amazingly entertaining game it is and the perfect antidote to today’s bloated, games as a service monstrosities. Anyone worried that it’s not long enough to justify the money, I’d say it’s the perfect length and at around 15 hours plus several more to 100% it I felt far more satisfied upon finally finishing it than I have with anything else for a long time.

It’s cheeky attitude and uncomplicated gameplay may seem simplistic at first but those dungeons are hard! Much harder than anything in Zelda: Breath Of The Wild and certainly more than any other modern game with their ‘press this to win’ attitude to puzzles. I was absolutely convinced that the seventh dungeon was completely impossible at least three times, and that there must be something wrong with my copy, but in the end I beat it and the feeling of satisfaction was immense.

It worked so well I immediately wanted something else from the same era but I’m a bit torn. A Link To The Past seems too obvious at the moment so I think it’d be more interesting to see Oracle of Seasons and Ages or The Minish Cap. My memory of the two Capcom games is that they weren’t as good as regular Nintendo ones but I honestly can’t remember them very well. But a double remake with both, and the aborted third game, would be very interesting to me.

What do others think? I want to see more 2D Zeldas, not just the 3D games.

Kurt
